image.altText: Davide Pollina smiles, wearing a fluro orange hoodie pulled over his head with a white hard hat over the top.

props.synopsis: A 19-year-old motorcyclist killed in a collision with an allegedly stolen car in Melbourne's north on the weekend has been described as a loving son and dedicated worker.

title.children: Motorcyclist killed in collision with allegedly stolen car remembered as loving son, hard worker

image.altText: Debris from a helicopter crash in Far North Queensland.

props.synopsis: Up to 400 people were evacuated from the DoubleTree by Hilton on Cairns Esplanade after the crash, which set the top of the building alight.

title.children: Pilot dies in 'unauthorised flight' after crashing into roof of Far North Queensland hotel

image.altText: Sean Moran is wearing hoodie with cap and sunglasses, standing on farm with cows in paddock.

props.synopsis: Sean Moran has been anxiously awaiting a decision on a proposed road that could split his farm on Victoria's Bellarine Peninsula in half.

title.children: Proposed road remains 'on the back burner', leaving Victorian farmers in limbo for seven years

image.altText: Joe biden seen against a black background looking serious

props.synopsis: The 81-year-old gives his first interview since quitting the race, discussing Donald Trump, the Harris-Walz ticket, and what will be at stake in November.

title.children: Donald Trump 'a genuine danger', says outgoing president Joe Biden in first interview after quitting re-election bid

image.altText: A man winces looking at the camera as he wrings liquid from some black material.

props.synopsis: In the deeply disparaging texts, the former Spotlight executive producer repeatedly refers to a fictitious character wanting to cave someone's head in.

title.children: Former Seven Spotlight boss's 'anti-Semitic' text messages revealed

image.altText: Snoop Dogg, the Golden Voyager, and Leon marchand composite image at the paris olympics closing ceremony

props.synopsis: From a sci-fi adventure to an athlete rebellion, movie icons and a banging soundtrack linking the Stade de France to Venice Beach, here's all the best bits from the Paris Olympics' Closing Ceremony.

title.children: Closing Ceremony quick hits: Snoop Dogg raps, Tom Cruise rides, and Raygun gets the Aussies pumped up in Paris spectacle

image.altText: A year on from AUKUS and there is no clear plan for nuclear submarines

props.synopsis: Newly published documents of an updated AUKUS agreement have revealed a clause that gives the US, UK a way out of the nuclear deal. Follow live.

title.children: Updated AUKUS document reveals how UK, US could walk away from nuclear deal

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Greens not keen to rush CFMEU laws
A chorus of voices on gambling reform but nothing from the government... yet
Coalition on the attack over CFMEU

image.altText: Group of people standing holding a swag.

props.synopsis: A program making backpack swags for people sleeping rough resonates with prison inmates, as they are about 100 times more likely to have been homeless than the general population.

title.children: Prisoners use sewing skills to gift backpack swags to homeless people

image.altText: Jess Fox smiles as an Australian fan takes a selfie, in front of a bunch of other fans

props.synopsis: The Paris Olympics can officially be marked down as a complete success, but it was away from the athletic feats on fields and in pools that real value of the Games could be found.

title.children: What the Paris Olympics taught us about joy, hope and each other

image.altText: A woman with short hair in an apartment holding a portrait photo of a man in a suit.

props.synopsis: Over the 21st century, fatal overdoses have begun to grow in Australia's suburban and regional areas. Some say the answer is safe injecting facilities. But would it help?

title.children: Fatal drug overdoses are accelerating in Australian suburbs. It's led to a controversial call

image.altText: Last day (1)

props.synopsis: Matt Glaetzer 'does a Bradbury' to claim bronze, New Zealand marks new ground with an emotional haka, and the final finisher in the women's marathon gets a hero's welcome. Here are some moments you may have missed overnight in Paris.

title.children: Olympic quick hits: Aussie 'does a Bradbury' after cycling stack, an emotional haka for Kiwi champ, and marathon runner gets a hero's ovation

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holds up his hand to take a question at ta press conference

props.synopsis: Politics is best played as a game of offence, but for incumbents across the world in what feels like a never-ending cost of living crisis, it has become a battle of defence and managing souring public sentiment.

title.children: A new phase of the political battle about to start as Albanese reaches for the reset button

image.altText: Two AFP cars and an officer outside Parliament House.

props.synopsis: The union representing Australian Federal Police officers warns that officers will abandon their posts at Parliament House later this week if their pay demands are not met.

title.children: 'We stop terrorists': AFP officers threaten to walk off the job at Parliament House amid pay dispute

image.altText: The side of a building with a wall collapsed and trees desrtoyed with rubble around

props.synopsis: Gazan officials say at least 90 people were killed in an air strike on a school, but Israel is refuting the severity, claiming it was targeting Hamas militants.

title.children: Israel struck a Gaza school on the weekend. Here's what we know

image.altText: Raygun performs at the Paris Olympics

props.synopsis: Australia's Raygun may have scored zero points in the breakdancing event, but the lead judge says her performance is exactly what the competition at the Olympics was all about.

title.children: 'All about originality': Olympics breakdancing judge joins community backing Raygun amid online criticism

image.altText: A close up of a McDonalds sign above a restraunt on a street.

props.synopsis: Concerned shareholders are using their small financial stakes to push companies like McDonald's to confront the issue. Here's what happened when a group of Texan nuns and an Australian super fund did just that.

title.children: Why the rise of 'superbugs' could have the same impact as the next global financial crisis

image.altText: Matthew Glaetzer stands with his arms outstretched

props.synopsis: Matthew Glaetzer has waited his whole career for an Olympic medal. Now, after a decade of bad luck, some finally goes his way in a dramatic keirin final that sees both he and Matthew Richardson win medals.

title.children: Aussie sprinters end stunning Olympics on emphatic high

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: ASX gains 0.7 per cent on opening boosted by Wall Street shrugging off recession fears. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX opens 0.7 per cent higher, JB Hi-Fi impresses with result

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: RBA deputy governor takes aim at 'false prophets'
ASX up 0.6% heading into the afteroon session
ASX 200 up 0.7% on opening, JB Hi-Fi surges on results

image.altText: A white carriage drawing a glass hearse box with a pink coffin inside it on the street outside a church with two white horses

props.synopsis: The family of one of the victims of the Southport stabbing attack have appealed for an end to the violent riots across the UK.

title.children: Parents of murdered nine-year-old Southport girl call for end to UK riots

image.altText: A man stands holding a tent looking at a fire coming out of a building after being bombed

props.synopsis: Hamas accused Israel of delaying agreements to perpetuate the war in Gaza, specifically citing Saturday's deadly air strike on a school in Gaza city.

title.children: Hamas urges ceasefire mediators to push Israel to accept earlier deal

image.altText: A baby on its back with its feet in focus

props.synopsis: About 2,000 families endure the pain of stillbirth every year but up to 30 per cent of stillbirths are considered preventable. Now there's concern a national plan to reduce the rates will fall short of its target as the deadline approaches.

title.children: Kirstin hopes the loss of her daughter will mean other families don't experience stillbirth

image.altText: Liberal MP Vincent Tarzia addresses the media.

props.synopsis: South Australia's Liberal Party has elected Vincent Tarzia as its new leader, replacing David Speirs, who announced his resignation last week.

title.children: SA Liberal Party elects Vincent Tarzia as new leader to replace David Speirs

image.altText: beachside mansions at noosa heads

props.synopsis: Across Australia renters are facing record-high rents and low vacancy rates. But how much platforms like Stayz and Airbnb are to blame depends on who you ask.

title.children: Renters fear being pushed out of coastal market where short-term stays outnumber rentals 17 to 1

image.altText: a man in a brown suede jacket sitting behind a desk with a radio presenter microphone to the side

props.synopsis: The ABC Radio Sydney presenter was diagnosed with oesophageal cancer in December. Two doctors "who both know best" gave him two different options.

title.children: Three days out from his cancer surgery, James Valentine faced a choice

image.altText: Ugandan men in masks and jackets carry stretchers over a huge pile of mud and rubbish.

props.synopsis: A rescue operation is underway after a large chunk of garbage broke off the landfill on Friday evening, crushing and burying homes on the edge of the site as residents slept.

title.children: Eighteen dead after garbage 'landslide' crushes houses at Ugandan capital's only rubbish dump

image.altText: Dog wearing an ID photo

props.synopsis: A company policy to allow dogs in the workplace has expanded from one day to five at a Hobart-based business after employees discover the health benefits of having pets in the office.

title.children: 'We're really focused on employee wellbeing': The office where pets are welcome

image.altText: A burning building

props.synopsis: Russia is fighting intense battles against thousands of Ukrainian troops as deep as 20 kilometres inside the Kursk region after Ukraine's biggest attack on Russian sovereign territory since the start of the war.

title.children: Russia evacuates more than 76,000 people in Kursk region, Zelenskyy vows to 'restore justice'

image.altText: Two huge towers are seen from far away with black smoke billowing from the right one, with a river in front of them

props.synopsis: A cooling tower away from the main nuclear reactors was on fire as Ukraine's president accused Russia of destabilising the safety of the plant.

title.children: Fire extinguished at Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant

image.altText: A young girl with a school bag holds onto her mother. A playground can be seen in the background.

props.synopsis: You're about to do school drop-off and your child says they want to stay home. So, what should you do?

title.children: Is it OK to keep your child home from school if they're tired?

image.altText: A medium sized dog with white fluffy hair sits, with a woman behind her.

props.synopsis: Animal rescue organisations say they are struggling to cope amid a surge in pet surrenders, with RSPCA ACT saying they are seeing a 30 to 40 per cent increase from last year.

title.children: Designer dogs among pets being abandoned as rescue organisations swamped by unwanted animals

image.altText: a young boy in a black hat stands next to cattle pen in red shirt

props.synopsis: Junior US bull riders have flown up to 30 hours to take on Australian cowboys at the largest and richest rodeo in the southern hemisphere.

title.children: America's best cowboys hold on for dear life at outback rodeo against Aussie rivals

image.altText: A composite image showing a purple aurora and a planet in space with rings

props.synopsis: What's filled you with awe in the night sky? We've narrowed it down to an incredible 10 things that have stunned and inspired you from auroras to shooting stars. Now it's time to vote!

title.children: Ever seen a moonbow? These are the ten most amazing things to see in the Australian night sky
